title: BBC Local Live: Stoke & Staffordshire on Wednesday 7 October 2015 - BBC News
summary: staffordshire footballer dies after multiple heart attacks in turkey .
nhs hospital trust plans care changes due to £ 6.5m deficit .
man cut free from car with serious injuries after staffordshire crash .

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: live updates for staffordshire and cheshire have finished for the day but we 'll be back from 08:00 thursday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: weather : a dry but chilly night
text: cloud thinning and breaking over the course of the night .
under clear skies temperatures could fall down to single figures 5-6c in rural areas ( 41-43f ) .
tomorrow , any patches of mist and fog will start to lift and clear over the course of the morning .
then there 'll be some cloud around for the afternoon with the possibility of some brightness where the cloud breaks .
feeling a little fresher with highs of 14c ( 57f ) .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: your leaves falling on autumnal walk
text: autumn is really kicking in now with the leaves falling from the trees and , as if to prove it , @ swanwhisperer sent this in from a walk yesterday to westport lake , stoke-on-trent .
i 'd love to see your photos if you want to share them with us , and i 'll feature as many as possible on the stoke and staffordshire live page .
you can email them , tweet to @ twitterid or put them on instagram ( just add # bbcstoke if you want to share them ) .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: more complaints made against police in staffordshire
text: there 's been an increase in the number of complaints made against staffordshire police .
the figures for the last 12 months show a rise of 66 % year-on-year in staffordshire , with more than 500 complaints made .
the force says the rise is because of a change in how the independent police complaints commission told them to record the complaints .
author: Lee Blakeman
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: man found on cannock street died from 'blunt head injuries '
text: thedeath of a man in cannock'sbeing treated as `` unexplained '' by police who say he died from `` blunt head injuries '' .
staffordshire police say paul cross , 55 , was found lying in harrison road last thursday evening and died in hospital the following day .
the force says a post-mortem examination 's been carried out and the provisional cause of death is blunt head injuries - more tests are going to be carried out .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : midfielder set to return for port vale
text: port vale midfielder michael o'connor will make his comeback from a long-term knee injury in tonight 's under-21 game match against stoke city .
it 's the same game in which stoke 's injured captain ryan shawcross is also expected to play , for the first time in months
vale manager rob page told bbc radio stoke it 'll be good to see o'connor back .
fantastic to get somebody like him back involved in the squad , that 's a positive for us to get him back involved .
author: BBC Radio Stoke Sport

documents.title: 'mystery smell ' school to stay shut as tests carried out
text: a school in stafford isexpected to stay shut for at least a weekas investigations continue into a mystery smell .
about 20 pupils fell ill at flash ley community primary school and nursery on friday , which was later evacuated .
tests have been carried out to find the source of the unpleasant odour and the site may not open next week , a letter from headteacher simon barker said .
the council said some children were sick , but it is not yet known if the smell is connected to their illness .
author: Emma Thomas
Journalist, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: hospital jobs 'safe ' despite £ 6.5m deficit
text: jobs at the nhs trust which runs leighton hospital in crewe are safe , according to its chief executive , despite a £ 6.5m deficit .
tracey bullock , ceo of themid cheshire hospitals nhs foundation trust , says it 's sharing more services with the royal stoke university hospital in a bid to save money .
however she says staff in crewe are n't losing work .
if we squeeze out every ounce of efficiency in our organisation that would probably give us about £ 3m - that is nowhere near solving the problem .
author: Lee Thomas
Journalist, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: villagers ' anger as faulty mast leaves them with no mobile signal
text: villagers near lichfield have been left without a mobile phone signal for almost a week .
author: Lichfield Mercury

documents.title: news : care changes planned by hospital and tributes after death of leek footballer
text: staffordshire and cheshire 's latest headlines :
- the boss of leighton hospital in crewe says the trust ca n't find the savings it needs without making changes in care
- a junior leek town footballer has died after suffering multiple heart attacks while on holiday with his family in turkey
- a man has been cut free from his car and airlifted to hospital after a crash in staffordshire today
author: Lee Blakeman
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: travel : still slow traffic after earlier staffordshire crash
text: there 's still slow traffic on the a38 in both directions in canwell hall , at the brockhurst lane junction .
it 's because of an accident earlier on - congestion is back to bassetts pole island and the little hay lane junction .
traffic : both carriageways of # a38 near # weeford now open .
thanks to all motorists that were delayed/diverted for your patience
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: man airlifted after three-vehicle crash
text: a man has been cut free from his car and airlifted to hospital after a crash in staffordshire today .
the west midlands ambulance service say two vans and a car collided on the southbound a38 between weeford and bassetts pole this morning .
the man airlifted to hospital was the car driver who 's believed to be 50-years-old .
paramedics say he 'd suffered a serious head injury and was in `` a reduced level of consciousness '' .
he was also treated for suspected chest injuries and doctors anaesthetised him to stabilise his condition .
author: Terry Goodwin
News Editor, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: main road in alsager closed for three weeks
text: a main route through alsager has shut from today for the next three weeks , for resurfacing work .

people living on crewe road have told bbc radio stoke they feel cheshire east council have n't thought the disruption through clearly enough - the authority says people will be on site to offer help during the work .
author: Lamont Howie
Reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: driver receives points after being caught speeding on christmas day
text: a burton man has been given points on his licence after he was caught speeding - on christmas day last year .
author: Burton Mail

documents.title: weather : cloud and chilly night ahead
text: this afternoon there 's plenty of cloud around - in places this will begin to thin and break , leaving the chance for some brighter spells this afternoon .
highs : 15c ( 59f ) .
then tonight , the cloud will thin and break over the course of the night .
under clear skies temperatures could fall down to single figures 5-6c in rural areas ( 41-43f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: football : burton boss up for monthly award
text: burton albion 's jimmy floyd hasselbaink has been nominated for the league one manager of the month award for september .
the brewers are three points clear at the top of the table after winning three of their five matches in the month .
hasselbaink is up against southend 's phil brown , bury manager david flitcroft and colchester boss tony humes , with the winner announced on friday .
author: Owen Bradley
BBC Sport

documents.title: watch : panto star gives radio presenter fashion advice
text: i was meant to just be interviewing jonathan wilkes and christian patterson about this year 's regent theatre panto - but instead i ended up getting some fashion advice
i 'll keep you posted if that mirror does make an appearance and , if you missed the interview , it 'll be on the iplayer .
video : watch @ twitterid get some fashion advice from regent theatre panto star @ twitterid
author: James Watt
Presenter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: hospital plans care changes to tackle £ 6.5m deficit
text: the boss of leighton hospital in crewe says the trust ca n't find the savings it needs without making changes in care .
tracey bullock is the chief executive of the mid cheshire hospitals nhs foundation trust and told bbc radio stoke it 's facing a £ 6.5m deficit this year .
she says one of the ways it 's looking to save money is by sharing more services with the royal stoke university hospital
author: Matt Jackson
Producer, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: body of missing man found
text: the body of a man who went missing from blythe bridge has been found , police say .
staffordshire police say 32-year-old michael heath was discovered in draycott at this afternoon .
they say his family has been told and the death is not being treated as sus
author: Lee Blakeman
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: news : body of missing man found and cheshire hospital facing funding deficit
text: staffordshire and cheshire 's top stories
- the body of a man who went missing from blythe bridge has been found , staffordshire police say
- the boss of leighton hospital in crewe says the trust ca n't make the savings it needs to and that 's going to mean changes in care
- tributes have been paid a young leek town player who 's died after suffering multiple heart attacks while on holiday in turkey
author: Lee Blakeman
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: appeal ensures pig farm saga continues
text: an appeal has been lodged which could see a pig farm set up in foston as protestors continue to fight the plans .
author: Uttoxeter Advertiser

documents.title: football : penalty save ca n't stop alex exit
text: crewe alexandra are out of the johnstone 's paint trophy asthey lost 3-2at home to wigan .
goalkeeper ben garratt saved a penalty in the first minute and the alex twice took the lead , but had defender george ray carried off .
the playertweeted after the game that he had a sore cheekbone : `` thanks to all the staff and paramedics at crewe for the speed they got to me on the pitch last night .
never nice getting in them situations . ''
thanks to all the staff and paramedics at crewe for the speed they got to me on the pitch last night .
never nice getting in them situations .
@ twitterid get well soon !
@ twitterid get well soon george hope to see you on the pitch again
@ twitterid glad that you are okay george hope to see you back on the pitch very soon take care .
@ twitterid how are you feeling george ? , hope nothings broken .
author: Graham McGarry
Crewe Alexandra commentator, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: council rules out taking a part in a combined authority
text: south staffordshire district council has announced it will not be a part of the new west midlands combined authority .
it follows a meeting of its cabinet in which councillors decided the benefits of being an associate member were `` unclear '' .
leader of the council , brian edwards , said the council would still be supportive of the idea though and would be prepared to work alongside the others councils involved .

we believe it is unlikely that south staffordshire council would add much to the combined authority , and , in return , it would add little over and above current arrangements for south staffordshire council , its residents and its businesses
author: BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: on-air : hanging around in staffordshire
text: i 'm continuing to find great stories in trentham as we focus on the area as our community of the week on the afternoon show .
one of my visits took me to trentham gardens where i had a go at making a hanging basket from pansies and ivy .
kevin from the site taught me - i 'm not sure he was impressed with my efforts .
author: Max Mallen
Reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: your hospital lit up at night
text: it 's not always of wildlife or landscapes that are attention grabbing - sometimes one of local buildings can just work so well .
jenna raven goodwin sent it to the bbc radio stoke facebook page , adding it 's `` the good old hospital , sitting empty and abandoned '' in stoke-on-trent .
you can send them in like jenna on the facebook page or tweet them to @ twitterid
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: disabled tamworth woman forced to give up motability car
text: a disabled tamworth woman who is unable to walk says she is being penalised for being ill - after disability officials said she can walk and must give up her motability car .
author: Tamworth Herald

documents.title: football : fans praised as burton head into top of the table clash
text: the burton albion manager jimmy floyd hasselbaink has praised the support from the club 's fans ahead of their next game away to second-placed walsall .
speaking at his press conference this morning , he said he hopes `` the support keeps on coming like at chesterfield .
it is very important for the players . ''
hasselbaink also said he 's considering his options for the next game , saying `` we need to look at walsall to see who can open them up . ''
jfh : the players do appreciate the support so i hope they keep on coming out in numbers .
author: BBC Radio Stoke Sport

documents.title: family of bosley mill blast victim say still 'no closure '
text: the family of a staffordshire moorlands man killed in the bosley mill explosion say they need answers .
will barks , from cheddleton , was killed in the blast in july and his family have still not been able to hold a funeral for him .
an inquest into his death will be opened on 19 october - his stepfather has told bbc radio stoke the waiting has been upsetting and stressful .
we 're waiting for an inquest on the 19th of october to decide whether he 's coming home or whether they 're going to keep him any longer .
we kind of got no closure on it or anything like that - we ca n't organise a funeral .
author: Ros Chimes
Reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: news : multi-million pounds deficit for hospital and staffordshire teen dies abroad
text: the main stories this lunchtime for staffordshire and cheshire
- the boss of leighton hospital in crewe says the trust ca n't make the savings it needs to and that 's going to mean changes in care
- a teenage footballer from staffordshire has died after suffering multiple heart attacks on holiday in turkey
- the scene of the bosley wood mill blasts is still being searched by cheshire police , nearly three months after four workers were killed .
author: Lee Blakeman
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: driver suffers serious injuries in multi-vehicle crash
text: a driver 's been airlifted to hospital after a three-vehicle crash in staffordshire today .
staffordshire police say it happened at around 10:30 on the southbound side of the a38 near weeford , towards the bassetts pole island .
they say the driver 's been taken to the queen elizabeth hospital , birmingham with serious head and chest injuries .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fly-tipping crimes double in last three years
text: the rate of rubbish illegally dumped in burntwood and lichfield has doubled since 2012 , a report has revealed .
author: Express and Star

documents.title: former drug addicts offered help in staffordshire town
text: people who have recovered from drug and alcohol addiction are being offered the chance to live and work in cannock .
a house in the town has been renovated to offer accommodation and a new tea room which will be staffed by former addicts opens today .
it follows similar schemes in burton-upon-trent - we 'll have more on this story in our lunchtime update from 13:30 on bbc one .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: tributes to teen footballer who 's died on holiday
text: stoke city football club has been paying tribute to a teenage footballer from biddulph who 's died after suffering multiple heart attacks on holiday in turkey .
jordan burndred , 17 , was a leek town academy player .
his family say he passed away during the night and did n't suffer .
stoke city say jordan was a season card holder and their thoughts and prayers were with his family .
port vale 's carl dickinson also tweeted after hearing the news .
really sorry to hear about jordan mountford.thoughts and prayers go out to all his family and friends .
# scfc sends sincere condolences to the family and friends of jordan burndred , who has sadly passed away at the age of 17
@ twitterid such sad news .
rip jordan .
@ twitterid @ twitterid so sad at no age at all .
rip young man
jordan was an # scfc season card holder and the thoughts and prayers of everyone at the britannia stadium are with his family and friends
@ twitterid rip .
our thoughts are with family and friends at this very difficult time .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : multi-vehicle crash in staffordshire
text: weeford road in weeford is shut and there 's heavy traffic at the a38 junction , because of a multi-vehicle accident - congestion on the a453 is to bassetts pole island .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: defender stretchered off as port vale knocked out of trophy
text: port vale defender remie streete left the field on a stretcher as port vale lost 2-1 at home to blackpool in the johnstone 's paint trophy .
midfielder anthony grant scored a penalty but it was n't enough to stop vale going out of the competition .
after the game streete tweeted `` nothing serious only a head injury tonight the stretcher was a precaution .
feeling fine . ''
author: Lee Blakeman
Port Vale commentator, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: stafford school closed in wake of mystery health scare
text: stafford 's flash ley primary school dramatically shut its doors in the wake of 20 youngsters reportedly being sick and dizzy - as other pupils handed them sick bowls .
author: Staffordshire Newsletter

documents.title: your cannock chase in hazy sunlighttweet @ twitterid
text: i can imagine the quiet atmosphere in this of cannock chase that 's come from michael bamber .
we just love featuring your photos on the stoke and staffordshire live page so if you 've got a you want to share , send it in !
you can do thaton email , tweet @ twitterid them on instagram ( adding # bbcstoke to the description if you agree to share them ) .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bosley mill explosion : search continues months after blast
text: the scene of the bosley wood mill blasts is still being searched by cheshire police , nearly three months after four workers were killed .
the force says the investigation into the circumstances around july 's tragedy is progressing , and will carry on for the `` foreseeable future '' .
the inquests into the deaths of two workers , dorothy bailey from bosley and william barks from cheddleton , is due to open on 19 october .
author: Lee Thomas
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: football : injured captain due to make a playing return for stoke city
text: stoke city captain ryan shawcross should make his long-awaited return from injury tonight .
he 's expected to play in the under-21 game at port vale as he continues his recovery from back surgery .
stoke 's assistant manager , mark bowen told bbc radio stoke that shawcross is raring to go .
he 's been working really hard and done two or three days good training with the under-21s squad because they were going to train at a higher intensity than we were going to be doing .
it would have set him up well for the game tonight at port vale .
author: Matt Sandoz
Stoke City commentator, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: more than 100 jobs up for grabs at warehouse in burton
text: more than 100 new jobs at a major crafts warehouse in burton are now up for grabs for `` enthusiastic and energetic '' individuals looking for work .
author: Burton Mail

documents.title: on-air : should it be easier to switch energy firms ? tweet @ twitterid
text: morning , i want to know how easy have you found it to change energy suppliers ?

i 'm asking as i 've had a bit of a `` mare '' recently and i do n't think i 'm alone , especially as we keep being told - as recently as this bbc news article in 2015 - of the money we could save and that it should be straightforward .
so what 's your experience been , i want to know - get involved on email or tweet @ twitterid
author: Perry Spiller
Presenter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: news : teen footballer dies on holiday and school shut as 'strange odour ' investigated
text: the latest headlines for staffordshire and cheshire
- a teenager from staffordshire who suffered multiple heart attacks on holiday in turkey has died
- the family of a staffordshire man killed in the bosley wood mill explosion say they still ca n't hold his funeral
- a stafford primary school is closed as the county council investigate the source of a strange odour
author: Lee Thomas
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: school shut as 'strange odour ' probed by council
text: a stafford primary school is closed as the county council is investigating the source of a strange odour .
flash ley school on hawksmoor road has been shut all week as the authority carried out tests and is now waiting for the results .
the school says it 's looking at alternative arrangements for pupils if it needs to stay closed beyond this week .
the well-being of children and staff in schools is our top priority .
a decision was therefore taken to close flash ley school as a precautionary measure due to a strong odour noticed in some parts of the school .
author: Emma Thomas
Journalist, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: train service back to normal in cheshirenational rail
text: all trains are running normally between stockport and crewe / stoke-on-trent following a signalling problem at cheadle hulme .

documents.title: weather : chance of flooding this morning
text: there could be some flooding in places today as the met office has a yellow weather warning in force for rain across the west midlands this morning .
most areas will see some rain but where heavier bursts occur there could be a risk of travel disruption due to spray , standing water and a small risk of localised surface water flooding .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: teenage footballer dies in turkey after 'multiple heart attacks '
text: a junior leek town footballer who suffered multiple heart attacks on holiday in turkey has died .
jordan burndred 's family broke the news through social media , saying the 17-year-old from biddulph did n't make it through the night .
they 're thanking people for their love and support through their `` nightmare '' .
author: Lee Thomas
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: travel : train delays on crewe routenational rail
text: new : delays between stockport and crewe / stoke-on-trent expected until 10:00 # cheadlehulme

documents.title: your autumn leaves
text: beautiful autumn leaves - this lovely photo 's come from jon kelso who took it in trentham , and it 's been as a bbc midlands today `` weather photo '' .
you can send in a photo to me for us to share and we 'll feature as many as possible on the stoke and staffordshire live page .
you can email them , tweet to @ twitterid or put them on instagram ( adding # bbcstoke if you agree to share them ) .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: brave jordan burndred , 17 , loses fight for life after holiday heart attack
text: teenager jordan burndred has lost his fight for life almost a fortnight after suffering a heart attack on holiday .
author: The Sentinel

documents.title: news : young footballer dies and bosley explosion family demand answers
text: the latest headlines for staffordshire and cheshire :
- a junior leek town footballer who suffered multiple heart attacks on holiday in turkey has died
- the family of a staffordshire moorlands man killed in the bosley mill explosion say they need answers
- a main route through a south cheshire town will close during the day today for three weeks of resurfacing
author: Lee Thomas
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: weather : heavy rain at times
text: there 'll be slow moving bands of rainmoving across the region throughout the morning - isolated bursts of rain could be heavy or thundery at times .
the rain will begin to clear in the late morning , leaving plenty of cloud around .
in places this will begin to thin and break leaving the chance for some brighter spells this afternoon .
highs : 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : delays on motorway in staffordshire
text: in staffordshirethere 's a lane closed with slow traffic and delayson the m54 eastbound between junction 1 and the m6 , because of bridge repairs .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: stoke and staffordshire live : what 's coming up on wednesday
text: morning everyone , it 's an overcast , grey start to wednesday as you can see from this of the bbc radio stoke hq in stoke-on-trent at 07:20 , with the regent theatre building lit up behind .
alex hamilton will be here shortly with the weather update and we 'll also have the latest news , sport , travel and more , along with your - got a couple of great autumn ones to start with .

you can share your photos with me and we 'll feature as many as we can on the stoke and staffordshire live page - use email , tweet @ twitterid or put them on instagram ( with # bbcstoke in the description if you agree to share ) .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live
